abstract: New York State prepares to initiate experimental Medicaid program that will eventually reward health care providers who improve conditions of their patients; state-federal partnership will include 25 high-volume practices that serve disadvantaged communities; will seek to incentivize closer monitoring and preventative care in order to reduce enormous public cost of hospital and emergency visits.
lead_paragraph: In a state-federal partnership, 25 groups are part of a trial that would eventually reward health care providers if the conditions of their Medicaid patients improve.

headline.main: Pay for Performance Extends to Health Care in New York State Experiment
headline.print_headline: Pay for Performance Extends to Health Care in New York Test

snippet: In a state-federal partnership, 25 groups are part of a trial that would eventually reward health care providers if the conditions of their Medicaid patients improve.
